page.title: 13LUTTON CHURCH
page.content: Lutton Church was built during the {14th }Century . It has a solid stone spire. The bricks probably came from {Hull}. It has solid stone floors and the tower is about {159 }feet high. It has {six }bells,and it has one of the lightest peals in {England}.It is white washed inside and there are many tombs in the church , of old {important}families .The wall around the grave-yard was paid for by a{ {Mr.Putterill }, in{ 1545}.There are still Putterill's living in the village today. The vicar of Lutton church is {Mr.Hawes }and he lives in the {vicarage. The church still plays an important part in village social life and many different functions are organised by the church for the village each year.
